legacyPatterns.description: Application is implemented as a Windows Service, which is not compatible with containerization
legacyPatterns.impact: Requires complete architectural change to run in containers
legacyPatterns.modernization: Convert to Worker Service or Web API with background processing

legacyPatterns.description: Uses System.Messaging for MSMQ queue processing
legacyPatterns.impact: MSMQ is Windows-specific and not available in Linux containers
legacyPatterns.modernization: Replace with Azure Service Bus, Azure Storage Queues, or RabbitMQ

legacyPatterns.description: Uses old-style csproj format with ToolsVersion attribute
legacyPatterns.impact: Not compatible with modern .NET SDK tooling
Cannot run on Linux containers required for Azure Container Apps
Code will not compile or run on Linux
Modern .NET uses appsettings.json and environment variables

legacyPatterns.description: Uses Console.WriteLine for logging in a Windows Service

architecturalChanges.description: Complete architectural redesign required from Windows Service to containerized application

messagingRefactoring.description: MSMQ must be replaced with cloud-native messaging (Azure Service Bus recommended)

platformMigration.description: .NET Framework to .NET 10 migration with removal of Windows-specific dependencies

codeComplexity.description: Business logic is straightforward - simple order processing

testCoverage.description: No existing tests, will need to add test coverage during migration

risks.mitigation: Thoroughly test message processing with Azure Service Bus to ensure feature parity
Document queue naming conventions and ensure proper Azure Service Bus queue/topic configuration
Implement proper graceful shutdown and health checks for container environment
Create comprehensive test suite before and after migration

prerequisites: Azure subscription with permissions to create Service Bus namespace
Access to migrate or recreate MSMQ queues in Azure Service Bus

phases.name: Architecture Transformation
tasks: Convert Windows Service to Worker Service

phases.name: Messaging Migration
tasks: Implement Azure Service Bus message receiver
Update Order serialization (JSON instead of XML)
Add retry policies and error handling

phases.name: Azure Container Apps Deployment
tasks: Set up Azure Service Bus connection

requiredChanges: Convert to Worker Service or Web API
Replace MSMQ with Azure Service Bus
postMigrationBenefits: Cloud-native messaging with Azure Service Bus
Automatic scaling based on message queue depth

immediate: Create backup/documentation of current MSMQ configuration and message schemas
Set up Azure Service Bus namespace for development/testing
Add comprehensive test coverage before migration
architecture: Use Worker Service pattern with IHostedService
Implement Azure Service Bus for message processing
Add structured logging with Application Insights
Implement health checks for container orchestration
deployment: Deploy to Azure Container Apps with managed identity
Configure auto-scaling based on Service Bus queue metrics
bestPractices: Implement comprehensive error handling and retry logic
Use Azure Key Vault for secrets management
Implement proper shutdown behavior for graceful container termination
